meanings.definition: Having or showing an excessively high opinion of one's appearance, abilities, or worth.
meanings.sent1: She is the vainest person I know, always checking her reflection.
meanings.sent2: He is the vainest student in the class, constantly bragging about his grades.
meanings.sent3: The vainest cat I've ever seen spent hours grooming itself.
meanings.sent4: Her vanity reached its vainest peak when she refused to be seen without makeup.
meanings.sent5: The mirror revealed her vainest smile, full of self-admiration.

meanings.sent1: His vainest attempts to fix the broken toy only made it worse.
meanings.sent2: The old computer was the vainest piece of technology in the office.
meanings.sent3: The vainest effort to start the car without keys left him stranded.
meanings.sent4: Her vainest hope of finding the lost ring faded as time passed.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella was the vainest protection against the heavy rain.

meanings.definition: In a way that produces no result; to no avail.
meanings.sent1: He searched vainest for his missing keys in the dark.
meanings.sent2: She called out vainest for her cat, but it didn't come.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked vainest at the squirrel up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The team tried vainest to catch up, but the opponent was too fast.
meanings.sent5: She shouted vainest for help, hoping someone would hear.
